 Regardless of which way the economy goes, or the markets, those who understand what is going on will always do well. Even through the depression and WWII the wealthy on both sides of the conflict remained wealthy and in most cases increased their wealth. 
 
 It is stagnation that is the enemy of wealth. Whether the economy took off tomorrow or tanked tomorrow, those who are able to react and know how to react properly, can make a killing. It is the general public, the Joe sixpacks out there who have been working for years to put a pittance in a managed investment (401K, annuity, etc...) that ends up footing the bill for an economic crash. 
 
 No great scheme is needed, nor are any special trade arrangments required. Proper investment strategy and the ability to forecast without blinders is the key, as well as having pre defined crisis management strategies. Warren Buffet once said "The best profits are made in the split second when everybody else is still trying to figure out what is going on". He is right. Sit down, try to think of as many differnt scenarios as you can, and then think of all the ways you can possibly profit from that scenario. Then pull the RAW DATA (becuase government numbers are lies and have been for years) and classify those scenarios as best case, worst case, and most probable. Then make sure that you have the required infrastructure in place to mobilize your plans if and when you need to.
